CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 27, 1939, pg. 18, reads: "Gaines Funeral Home Reflects 'The World of Tomorrow' Most Modern Equipment Plus Scientific, Efficient Service Marks New Step Forward ... Pictures reading top left to right: ... GENERAL OFFICE - Photo shows left, Mrs. Mabel Ballard, and right, Mrs. Natalie Fields-Fowler. Stenographer and bookkeeper and Notary Public to take care of all your needs.  When you are bereaved you may, with reliability, leave any and all papers with Gaines.  The firm will attend to the smallest detail for you...THE FUNERAL services may be held in home, in the church or in Gaines' well appointed chapel.  Complete arrangements for the services will be made by one of the staff, including the minister of the family's choice, the music and musicians and even the pallbearers, if desired. - Photos by Harris ... George W. Gaines, Director of Funerals ... 220 Auburn Street, E. E., Pittsburgh, Pa."
TitMainTitle: Mabel Ballard wearing striped dress on left, and Natalie Fields - Fowler at switchboard on right, in office of Gaines Funeral Home
